Teachers and staff - until this decision is finalized you do not need to report to work unless your supervisor has talked with you directly.

"When you work with seniors spring is your favorite time of year, because they become so excited and start to solidify their plans for after high school. Since we can’t have those moments in person we want to recognize them as much as we can. They are about to take some of the biggest steps in their lives and they deserve a shout out from us and the community to celebrate what they have done at Linn-Mar and the good they will do out in the world." Jennifer Thurston, Linn-Mar School Counselor

“As soon as we learned buildings were opening for a quick “grab and go” for materials on Monday, we took advantage of the opportunity and pulled all of the food totes from the schools. We made 208 phone calls letting families know the scheduled food drop off would be Thursday 4/13/20. Thank you to our amazing employees! Because of your help organizing spreadsheets, making phone calls and delivering meals we were able to deliver 180 meals to students’ homes in all three days’ time.”– Kristi Hicks, Associate Director for Student Services #wearelinnmar

The food totes are a part of the Snow Day Assistance Program Linn-Mar started this winter thanks to Feeding Lunch to Youth (FLY).

A huge thank you also goes to Raining Rose, Inc. for their generous donation of individual hand sanitizers. When Raining Rose learned staff members were delivering to student homes, they ensured every staff member was able to have one or two hand sanitizers. #staypositive #staysafe

Grades PreK-8 ------ will be using the “Voluntary” model: Schools may not require students to participate or grade any work.

Grades 9-12 ------ will use the “Required” model: Academic work is equivalent in effort and rigor to typical classroom work.

We know many parents are wondering how we are going to do this. There will be more specific details available from building principals by the end of the week. We appreciate your patience as we work through our plans to best continue to Inspire Learning, Unlock Potential, and Empower Achievement at Linn-Mar.

More info with additional links here: https://www.linnmar.k12.ia.us/news/linn-mar-covid-19-educational-plan-approved-state/

Several Linn-Mar High School student clubs joined forces to help the food insecure.

Students from eight LMHS student clubs (Student Council, FFA, Red Cross Club, Key Club, Robotics, LM buddies, SODA, LMTV) are hosting a unified club project this month to gather donations and funds to support the LMHS Pride Food Pantry.

The pantry serves many students at the high school who have food insecurities and allows them to take the food home, discretely, without worrying where their next meal is coming from.

For an extra incentive, the student clubs have made this a challenge and the winning grade and class can receive discounts to the WPA dance later this month. #wearelinnmar

The Linn-Mar Varsity Poms competed at Nationals in Orlando, FL this weekend and came home with 3rd place in Poms and 4th place in Jazz!

Within the last 20 years, this is one of the best placements yet at Nationals! This is the 2nd time they have placed 3rd in Poms and 2nd time they have placed 4th. Congrats to the LM Poms! #wearelinnmar

This world can be a tough place for our kids; anxiety and depression in children is real. Being a parent isn’t easy and we’re often wondering if we’re being too hard or too easy on our kids. We wonder if we’re asking enough questions, or if we’re asking the right questions.

Linn-Mar Student Services has information available on the LM website for tips for handling anxiety and depression and signs or symptoms that parents can look for. Please visit our website for more info. http://ow.ly/HSGc50yaydB
